intro: Pilosella anchusoides subsp. floccipedunculoides, commonly known as the woolly mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in a cylindrical shape, forming a unique inflorescence. It thrives in rocky or alpine environments and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
